intro: Gilia tenuituba, commonly known as the slenderstem gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late spring to early summer. Gilia tenuituba is often found in open habitats such as grasslands, chaparral, and along streambanks.
